title: How to Cook Kare Kare with Oxtail

steps.headline: Boil the oxtail in the large pot for approximately 1 hour until cooked.
Strain the stock and put aside for later.
Grind the raw rice and toast in a pan until golden brown.
Heat the vegetable oil and annatto oil in a large pan.
Sauté the garlic and onions in the oil until browned.
Add the stock, browned rice, oxtail, and peanut butter.
Boil the mixture and simmer for 15 minutes.
Season to taste using salt and pepper.
Add eggplant, bok choy, and string beans to the stew and let them simmer for a few minutes until cooked.
steps.description:

steps.headline: Serve with white rice and bagoong and enjoy!

text:
Boil the oxtail in the large pot for approximately 1 hour until cooked. Strain the stock and put aside for later. Grind the raw rice and toast in a pan until golden brown. Put aside for later. Heat the vegetable oil and annatto oil in a large pan. Sauté the garlic and onions in the oil until browned. Add the stock, browned rice, oxtail, and peanut butter. Boil the mixture and simmer for 15 minutes. Season to taste using salt and pepper. Add eggplant, bok choy, and string beans to the stew and let them simmer for a few minutes until cooked. Make sure to submerge them in the stew and cover the pot. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1c\/Cook-Kare-Kare-with-Oxtail-Step-9Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Kare-Kare-with-Oxtail-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/1\/1c\/Cook-Kare-Kare-with-Oxtail-Step-9Bullet1.jpg\/aid1126787-v4-728px-Cook-Kare-Kare-with-Oxtail-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Serve with white rice and bagoong and enjoy!
